conclusion: To determine the pressure of the gas when the temperature is 600 K, we need to analyze both the p-T graph and the V-T graph.
At 400 K, the volume V is 2 m³.
At 600 K, the volume V increases to 3 m³.

premise: The volume changes from 2 m³ to 3 m³ between 400 K and 600 K.
conclusion: The gas undergoes an isobaric (constant pressure) process between these two temperatures.
From the p-T graph, the pressure at 400 K is approximately 1.05 × 10^5 Pa.

premise: The process between 400 K and 600 K is isobaric.
conclusion: The pressure at 600 K will be the same as at 400 K, approximately 1.05 × 10^5 Pa.
